bookCover.coverDescription: In this interactive book we will learn about invertebrates and it's different group.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Invertebrates: Invertebrates are animals without a backbone or vertebral column. In fact, invertebrates don’t have any bones at all. They are primitive animals, having less developed organs and systems. Invertebrates that you may be familiar with include spiders, worms, snails, lobsters, crabs, and insects like butterflies, mosquitoes, honeybees, cockroaches, dragonflies, etc.

As already stated, invertebrates have no backbone or skeleton within them. Instead, some have a tough outer shell (exoskeleton) for protection, while others have no hard parts in their bodies and have completely soft bodies.
This protects them against blows and predators, and keeps them from drying out.
The body softness enables the animals to enter in small gaps, holes, etc. for shelter and protection from predetors.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Invertebrates are the most diverse and numerous group of animals on Earth. Believe it or not, 97% of all the animals in the world are invertebrates. To make the study of invertebrates easier, they are classified into nine phyla or groups, on the basis of structure and development. All nine phyla are explained in the following:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Protozoa: Protozoa are single-celled or unicellular organisms that cannot be seen with our naked eyes. They come in many different shapes and sizes, ranging from an Amoeba, which can change its shape, to Paramecium with its fixed shape and complex structure. Some organisms in the protozoa phylum are parasitic, which means they live in other plants and animals, including humans, where they cause disease.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Porifera: Porifera are one of the most common types of invertebrate animals. Porifera are multicellular organisms that are mostly made up of tissue and do not have complex organs. They are asymmetrical aquatic animals of various colors, shapes, and sizes.They have numerous pores on their bodies. They are also commonly known as sponges.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Coelenterata: Coelenterates are jelly-like aquatic invertebrate animals that have a hollow body cavity called coelenteron. They are radially symmetrical and have tentacles that encircle a mouth at one end of the body. The tentacles help them in movement and in catching food.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Platyhelminthes: Platyhelminthes are structurally simple, wormlike invertebrate animals that lack anuses and circulatory systems. They have flat bodies, due to which it is also commonly known as flatworms.
Which of the following animal belongs to phylum protozoa?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

userSettings.feedbackText: Amoeba are unicellular and microscopic animals so, it belongs to phylum protozoa.

metadata.title: Q5-Which of the following animal do not belongs to phylum protozoa?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Annelida: Annelida is a group of invertebrate animals with segmented, muscular bodies. The digestive systems of annelids stretch from the mouth to the anus, and different sections of the system have different roles. Each segment contains parts of the organism's excretory, circulatory, reproductive, and nervous system.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Arthropoda: Arthropoda is the largest phylum in the animal kingdom. It is a group of invertebrate animals with jointed limbs and exoskeletons made of chitin. They contain sensory organs like hairs, antennae, simple and compound eyes, auditory organs, etc. and have a well-developed digestive system.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Aschelminthes: Aschelminthes, also commonly known as roundworm are invertebrates that have round and unsegmented body. They are usually small, even microscopic, while some reach a meter or more in length. Respiratory and circulatory systems are absent in them.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Mollusca: Mollusca, also commonly known as molluscs are group of invertebrate animals having a soft and unsegmented body. Because they are soft-bodied animals, most have hard shells made of calcium carbonate to protect their bodies from predators and the environment.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Phylum Echinodermata: Echinodermata, also commonly known as echinoderms are group of invertebrate marine animals that have spiny skins. Animals in this phylum are multicellular organisms with well-developed organ system. They are colourful organisms with unique shapes. Although most echinoderms are of small size, ranging up to 10 cm in length or diameter, some reach relatively large sizes.
Which of the following animal belongs to phylum aschelminthes?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

userSettings.feedbackText: Pinworms are categorized as aschelminthes because their bodies are round and unsegmented, with both ends pointy.
